main event: A well-defined, oval object was sighted in Northern California and Southern Oregon on July 3, 1961.
interesting points: The object was white to slightly yellow in color with a few small lights., It moved from northwest to southeast at an apparent speed of 3 to 5 degrees per second., The object dipped below the horizon and was obscured by trees., The observer had 6 years of experience and was deemed reliable., Conclusions suggested the object was likely either an aircraft or an astronomical phenomenon.
location: Northern California and Southern Oregon, USA
witness description: a reliable observer with 6 years of experience
